creator: spbeliveau@labvolt.ca
text:
I'm using 2 different jars in my common/lib and they are both using a same 
class. A function with the same name is used in each of 'em but the code in 
each function is different. Unfortunately, when the first jar is loaded, the 
code of the function seems to be kept in memory and when I call the same 
function in the 2nd jar, it uses the one of the first jar. Is there a way to 
fix this?
thanks
Simon-Pierre

You can only have one version of a class per classloader repository.  There are
a number of workarounds, such as renaming one of the classes or functions, or
moving one jar to another classloader.  You can get some advise on the user
mailing list regarding this issue.  But it's not a Tomcat bug.
creator: yoavs@computer.org
